text: I think the measure of a good life is is
to is to die well it's to get to the end
of the journey and not all of us will
will know when we're at the end of The
Journey because many of us will die
abruptly but many of us will and all of
us will age and all of us will walk
closer every single day to physical
death what's there's a wonderful line
from St Paul I think from Romans 8 about
you know like Lambs we are killed every
day and then later in the scriptures we
know we know we we know death and
because of that we know more and more of
life so we're always walking closer to
death uh um and it's in that knowledge
and it's in that walking that enables us
to look around and forward and backward
and think what am I doing you know how
am am I walking with whom am I talking
as I walk where am I stopping am I
going to get to the end of the journey
and be glad that I walked the way I did
not
exuberant not screaming with Ecstasy but
sound and satisfied and solid about what
I did the mistakes I made the
accomplishments that I found and and
achieved and the actual way way that I
put one foot in front of the other I
think the measure of a good life is a
lot about the
acknowledgment of the of our physical
forms coming to an end and our
willingness to at least take a look at
that occasionally
